climbs.name: Southern View
climbs.fa: James Garrett and Franziska Garrett, 20 January 2005

content.description:
Southern View and Messina ( a lovely climbing city in Sicily, are both South Facing and on a sandstone crag high up above the Douglas Fir Trees in Freeze Creek. You can climb here year round even approaching it with your skis as long as the sun is out. Excellent get away!

This is a fun, but tricky little climb. Find a Belay bolt on a nice flat rocky ledge. Face climb up the sandstone aretish feature past about 8 (numerous glue ins) bolts to the top and a two-bolt belay.

Beautiful and quiet area with guaranteed solitude.

Rappel the route or walk off.
content.location: This is NOT on the initial crag in Freeze Creek that one encounters hiking up Freeze Creek. This is NOT on the Freezer Buttress. This is visible from the trailhead on Pioneer Fork Road as a sandstone crag up near the ridge line. Hike past Freezer Buttress about 10 minutes (20-30 minutes from trailhead. Stay on the trail until it starts to veer west. bushwhack up the steepish hillside to the obvious sandstone crag. you will see the bolts.

climbs.name: Social Distance
climbs.fa: James Garrett and Franziska Garrett, 4 April 2020

content.description:
This is just up slope from Corona Crack and a belay bolt down low marks the start. Slither your way up the bulgy but featured slab past 5 glue in bolts to a two bolt (glue in Hilti/Bonier Hardware) belay.

If pulling down on the right side left facing dihedral An arms length away, the rock may be loose and untrustworthy. Beware of a Big unstable loose looking flake.....but easy to avoid.
content.protection: Glue in bolts. Only QDs needed.
content.location: Just two meters up and right of Corona Crack on the Sandstone Southern View.

climbs.name: Messina
climbs.fa: James Garrett and Franziska Garrett, 25 January 2007

content.description:
Messina is a sunny undiscovered climbing friendly city in Sicily. Hike up Freeze Creek to the south facing walls just past the big Douglas Fir Trees. Sandstone! A start to the right of Southern View, sharing the same anchors on top for a quick descent.

8 June 2019 Update: a few additional glue in bolts have been retrofitted to alleviate the run outs.
content.protection: Well protected. QDs. 9 Glue in Bolts.
content.location: This is 20 feet to the right of the Southern View on the same sandstone crag.

climbs.name: Corona Crack
climbs.fa: James Garrett and Franziska Garrett, 10 April 2020

content.description: Fun Obvious crack that climbs well to share the same two-bolt belay of the far right route called “Social Distance”.
content.location: After finding the Sandstone Southern View, this is the nice crack just a meter to the right (north) of Messina. East Facing.  It is the only continuous crack on the formation.
